intro: Wallrothia alpina, commonly known as the alpine wallrothia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered. Wallrothia alpina is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
